column4: desperately trying to get this fresh server install to have any internet/network connection at all and when i browse google etc i have found several places saying to either sudo route add default gw or /sbin/route add <etc> but whenever i attempt to do it i just get "SIOCADDRT: No such process"
I mean what does it look like exactly (as in paste it somewhere)
Ok, is there a "inet address: ..." line?
You haven't assigned an IP address to eth0
You can do this manually in /etc/network/interfaces, with `ifconfig eth0 <ip>` or via DHCP
It's not the router that hands out IP addresses but a DHCP server.
thanks! just assigning it an ip got it working
But yes, maybe the device you call "router" has one integrated ;-)
It won't remember. You'll have to put it in /etc/network/interfaces
what should it look like in /etc/network/interfaces ?  theres only 6 lines in the whole damn thing and nothing referencing eth0 at all, only references the loop back interface
Example: auto eth0 \n iface eth0 inet dhcp
That's all you need for DHCP client setup
Using DHCP should set the default route and nameservers too.
all working perfectly thanks :)  took me a while to remember how to use VI then, its been so long since i used linux at all let alone command line only --;
